Convert g_c (\(\mu\)mol CO2/m^2/s/Pa) to g_w (\(\mu\)mol H2O /m^2/s/Pa)

Source: R/convert-species.R
gw2gc.Rd

Convert g_c (\(\mu\)mol CO2/m^2/s/Pa) to g_w (\(\mu\)mol H2O /m^2/s/Pa)

Convert g_c (umol CO2/m^2/s/Pa) to g_w (umol H2O /m^2/s/Pa)

gw2gc(g_w, D_c, D_w, unitless, a)

gc2gw(g_c, D_c, D_w, unitless, a)

Arguments

g_w

conductance to water vapor in units (\(\mu\)mol H2O / (m^2 s Pa)) of class units.

D_c

diffusion coefficient for CO2 in air in units of m^2/s of call units

D_w

diffusion coefficient for H2O in air in units of m^2/s of call units

a

exponent used for conversion. Use 1 for still air; 0.67 for laminar flow (Jones 2014).

units

g_c

conductance to CO2 in units (\(\mu\)mol H2O / (m^2 s Pa)) of class units.

Value

Value with units \(\mu\)mol / (m^2 s Pa) of class units.

Details

Diffusive conductance to CO2 is greater than that of H2O because of the higher molecular weight. To convert:

$$g_\mathrm{c} = g_\mathrm{w} (D_\mathrm{c} / D_\mathrm{w}) ^ a$$ $$g_\mathrm{w} = g_\mathrm{c} (D_\mathrm{w} / D_\mathrm{c}) ^ a$$

Note

This function will soon be moving to the standalone gunit package.

References

Jones H. 2014. Plants and Microclimate (3rd edition). Cambridge University Press.

Examples

D_c = set_units(1.29e-05, "m^2/s")
D_w = set_units(2.12e-05, "m^2/s")
g_c = set_units(3, "umol/m^2/s/Pa")
g_w = gc2gw(g_c, D_c, D_w, unitless = FALSE)
#> Error in gc2gw(g_c, D_c, D_w, unitless = FALSE): argument "a" is missing, with no default
g_w
#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'g_w' not found

gw2gc(g_w, D_c, D_w, unitless = FALSE)
#> Error in set_units(., "umol/m^2/s/Pa"): object 'g_w' not found
